newsitem.title: USA: NYPA 832 MW Fitzpatrick nuke seen in startup today.
newsitem.headline: NYPA 832 MW Fitzpatrick nuke seen in startup today.

text.p: The New York Power Authority (NYPA) will likely begin startup of its 832 megawatt Fitzpatrick nuclear power plant today following a maintenance shutdown, a company spokesman said.
After startup testing the unit could synchronize to the electricity grid early Tuesday, spokesman Woody Berzins said.
"It could be a 24-hour cycle or it could be longer depending on how things go," Berzins said.
Fitzpatrick, located at Scriba, N.Y., was shut Jan 23 to remove fish and debris accumulated on screens in water intakes that supply cooling water to the plant.
Water from the intakes cools the plant's condenser and is returned to Lake Ontario.
NYPA produces about 25 percent of New York state's power.
